message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.IR 

This paper is about language modeling, which is a subfield of natural language processing (NLP) and falls under the category of computer science (cs). The use of sememes to represent the implicit semantics behind words is a novel approach to language modeling, which suggests that the paper is likely to be categorized under cs.CL (Computation and Language). 

The paper also proposes a new method for language modeling, which involves the use of sememe experts to jointly identify the most probable senses and the corresponding word. This suggests that the paper may also be categorized under cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing), as these subcategories are closely related to the development of new machine learning algorithms and techniques. 

Finally, the paper evaluates the proposed method on a downstream application of headline generation, which involves generating headlines based on the content of news articles. This suggests that the paper may also be categorized under cs.IR (Information Retrieval), as headline generation is a task that involves retrieving relevant information from a large corpus of text.
